definition: The population the studies findings is addressing. This can range from nursing staff to homeless to prisoners, which all have their own needs in the pandemic.
examples: Suburban Lahore

definition: The challenge the addressed population is facing.
examples: Overcrowding

definition: The solution to the challenge the addressed population is facing in the pandemic.
examples: As proposed by the author

definition: A section of the entire text used to highlight the important aspects for researchers/readers.
The sample that is obtained to test for a coronavirus infection. Most commonly Nasopharyngeal swabs are obtained, but also other swabs are evaluated.
examples: Nasal, Throat, Conjunctival, Nasopharyngeal, Oropharyngeal, broncho-alveolar lavage, Sputum, Respiratory tract, Blood, Semen, Fecal Matter, GI tract (Gastrointestinal tract), Rectal, Anal

definition: The severity of symptoms the cohort displays
examples: Possible values: Mild, Moderate, Severe, Varied, ICU, non-ICU

definition: Only used in tables regarding patients
examples: If the study is a meta analysis/ review this study additionally includes the number of studies/articles used for the review.

definition: Contributing factors to the subject of whatever the paper was testing/investigating.
examples: Temperature, Solar Radiation, Population Density, Precipitation

definition: Weather a factor is influential to the question's answer.
examples:
Y: the factor is influential to the questions answer.
N: the factor is not influential to the questions answer.

definition: All parameters regarding the age of the given cohort (mean, median, iqr, range) reported in the study.
examples: 5 YO, 5, 05 = Five years Old

definition: An assay is an analysis done to determine: The presence of a substance and the amount of that substance.
How long the assay is taking for the analysis
examples: realtime, x mins, x hours, x days in the way the study reports on this

definition: Weather the tool has been FDA approved
examples:
Y: FDA approved
N: not FDA approved

definition: The method used in this study. In modeling studies the model that has been used (e.g.) and in genetic related questions the extraction method that has been used (e.g.)
examples: Modelling studies describe the model used; genetic studies describe extraction methods used to test the relevant changes in genetic make-up

definition: The findings of the study related to the question
The material that is described in the study, which properties are described
examples: Materials currently are decontamination agents, sheddings routes (equal to sample obtained), surfaces.

definition: Whatever gives the study validity
examples:
For studies with patients (e.g. What do we know about viral shedding in stool?):
- How many patients (patients: 217); How many studies in review/meta analysis studies (studies: 116); Severity of Symptoms (severity: severe)

For modelling studies (eg. seasonality of transmission):
- Model used (model: SEIR); Countries modeled (countries: China); cities modeled (cities: Wuhan); provinces modeled (provinces: 90); Number of countries modeled (countries: 16); Population size modeled (people: 824000 / cases: 210 / patients: 8137)

For confirmation by Method (e.g. What is the evidence that domesticated/farm animals can be infected and maintain transmissibility of the disease? ):
- What method has been used to confirm the findings (detection: PCR-confirmed)

For confirmation by survery (e.g. Methods to control the spread in communities, barriers to compliance and how these vary among different populations):
- How many participants were included in the study (participants: 316)

definition: Medications to treat patients, but not limited to pharmaceuticals.
examples: azithromycin, hydroxycloroquine, breathing techniques, etc. Not limited to pharmaceutics.

definition: Whatever the author of the study decides the conclusion go the research has been.
A short version of the General Outcome/Conclusion Excerpt.
examples:
Y: significant clinical improved by the utilized Therapeutic method
N: no significant clinical improved by the utilized Therapeutic method

definition: Any measurement that reflects the accuracy of the test
examples: sensitivity: 98%; specificity: 85%; ..

definition: Percentage of patients that do not show symptoms
examples: 25% of population X did not show symptoms

definition: The percentage of people that were infected during the asymptomatic stage of the person infecting them.
The median and mean incubation periods. Incubation period refers to the time from infection to first symptoms.
any measurement related to the range of the incubation period (range, percentile. IQR). Incubation period refers to the time from infection to first symptoms.
mean, median and range of days the virus is still detectable in the sample after admission
examples: 10 days after admission

definition: mean, median and range of days the virus is still detectable in the sample after onset
examples: 15 days after onset, includes the time before admission

definition: Tissue Culture Infection Dose 50 is the concentration at which 50% of the cells are infected in a cell culture.
The maximum time the virus can be detectable in the material
examples: x minutes, x hours, x days, etc.

definition: Time until the detectable quantitiy of the virus is reduced to half of its original quantity
examples: 10 -> 5 -> 2.5 -> 1.25 -> ... The time take to half the sample remains constant.

definition: Infected people
examples: 2 infections; could be 2.2 if averaged

definition: Cases receiving care in the hospital
examples: 2 cases; could be 2.2 if averaged
